title: Eugenio Méndez
text:
Eugenio Méndez (born 23 November 1941) is a <a href="Chile">Chile</a>an former <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">winger</a> who played professionally in <a href="Chile">Chile</a>, <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a>, <a href="Ecuador">Ecuador</a> and <a href="Bolivia">Bolivia</a>.
Career.
Born in <a href="Valpara%C3%ADso">Valparaíso</a>, Méndez began playing football as a right winger with <a href="Santiago%20Wanderers">Santiago Wanderers</a>. He made his Chilean league debut against <a href="Audax%20Italiano">Audax Italiano</a> in 1959. After nine years with Wanderers, he joined <a href="Deportes%20Magallanes">Deportes Magallanes</a>, as Wanderers won its second Chilean league title the same year. Méndez returned to Wanderers and played in the <a href="1969%20Copa%20Libertadores">1969 Copa Libertadores</a>.
In 1973, Méndez moved abroad, joining <a href="Mexican%20Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n">Mexican Primera División</a> side <a href="Club%20de%20F%C3%BAtbol%20Laguna">Club de Fútbol Laguna</a>. Next, he played in <a href="Ecuador">Ecuador</a> for <a href="Sociedad%20Deportiva%20Aucas">Sociedad Deportiva Aucas</a> before returning to Santiago Wanderers in 1974. A few seasons later, he moved to Bolivia where he finished his playing career.
Méndez appeared for the <a href="Chile%20national%20football%20team">Chile national football team</a> in the <a href="1966%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1966 FIFA World Cup</a> qualifying rounds, scoring two goals in a 7–2 win against Colombia on 1 August 1965.
